hours_text:
# Visit

The Cyrus Dallin Art Museum is located in the historic Jefferson Cutter House in Arlington Center, just six miles from Boston on the route of Paul Revere’s ride and Revolutionary Battle Road.

**Street address:** 611 Massachusetts Avenue, Arlington, MA 02474  
**Mailing Address:** P.O. Box 266, Arlington, MA 02476  
**Parking:** Metered parking Monday through Saturday (free on Sunday) in the municipal lot behind the Museum. Driving directions can be found [here](https://www.google.com/maps/place/Cyrus+Dallin+Art+Museum/@42.4157389,-71.1545677,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x89e376507cf8d24b:0xc83980918849fa54!8m2!3d42.4157389!4d-71.1523737).

## Tours

The Dallin Museum is open on Saturdays and Sundays from 12-4 pm and by appointment. No reservations are necessary on weekends. Visitors are welcome to explore the galleries independently or take a tour with one of our friendly and knowledgeable guides.

_Thanksgiving weekend schedule: The Dallin Museum is open Saturday, November 29 and closed Sunday, November 30. We will resume regular hours on Saturday, December 6._

**Suggested donation:** $5 per person  
  
 _Enhanced sanitation efforts continue. Hand sanitizer is available throughout the museum. If you are feeling unwell, please visit another day._

## Group Tours

We are happy to customize a virtual or private in-person tour for your class, organization, or other special interest group. To make an appointment, contact Nancy Blanton at [nblanton@dallin.org](mailto:nb...

Discover an American Master

  * [](https://dallin.org/about-cyrus-dallin/)

## [Cyrus Dallin](https://dallin.org/about-cyrus-dallin/)

Cyrus Dallin (1861-1944) was a celebrated Utah-born sculptor, educator, and Indigenous rights advocate who lived and worked in Arlington, Massachusetts for over 40 years. Dallin’s public sculptures honoring Indigenous peoples,…

[Read More](https://dallin.org/about-cyrus-dallin/ "Continue Reading: Cyrus Dallin")

  * [](https://dallin.org/public-works/)

## [Public Works](https://dallin.org/public-works/)

Cyrus Dallin’s many public sculptures commemorating historical events, Indigenous peoples, and Euro-American figures bring beauty and a unique historical perspective to shared spaces across the nation, including Boston, Chicago, Philadelphia,…

[Read More](https://dallin.org/public-works/ "Continue Reading: Public Works")
